title: EUCLID - EdUcational Curriculum for the usage of Linked Data

author: Elena Simperl, School of Electronics and Computer Science, University of Southampton

segmentation: Well, welcome to the to the last presentation of the session I'm going to shortly present you coordination support action in the SMB call which is called Euclid.
Where we will develop and implement a curriculum to train practitioners in using linked data.
The consortium consists of four partners.
We have two SMS and two academic partners.
See I research is company based in Vienna that works closely together with an Association called SGI International.
As the international is the Semantic Technology Institute Association, it is Association that brings together around 40 institutions worldwild.
While the focus is is surely mainly in Europe, these organizations are not just universities but also.
To a large extent, SMS for which the Association organizes a wide variety of events.
So the point to take there is on the one side that through Essay International we have this link to two small medium enterprises.
There are interested in linked data and semantic technologies.
Second area of activity of SCI research is under the brand Sam Sphere which promotes an online certification program for for Semantic Technologies which we will.
Exploit in developing this curriculum.
In the project, the Second S Me of the consortium is on to text.
It's a it's a company that develops repository and RDF store which is graph database that is used in a number of industry projects.
This company is one of The Pioneers in using semantic technologies in large real world projects.
In particular, they are the one developing together with the BBC their link data solution and recently they have launched very successful training program for their customers.

Last but not least, we have the academic partners KIT as an academic institution with a with record and the semantic web area and also not just in developing an contributing to research methods and standards.

But also looking and ensuring that these these methods are transferred into into applications that have real use for consumers and not last but not least the largest online University distance learning University worldwide, which is the Open University, which in the consortium will provide the knowledge that there is required in order to develop curriculum training materials that are useful for large audiences.
So some of you might know.
The Open University has over 2000 and 50,000 students.
There are not students in the academic sense, so they come from a wide variety of backgrounds and as such the Open University has the right knowledge and background.
In order to ensure.

Whatever we technology providers in academics, providers as rough training materials, whatever we think that we need to teach people these, this rough content is translated into into training materials and training methods.
They are really applicable now.
Let me just walk you through the motivation for the project.
We have already heard something bottling data.
Some of you might just heard about it, but don't don't really know what it is.
What I can tell you is that there are more and more companies worldwide that are promoting this.
There are a couple of application scenarios that are particularly prominent.
I mentioned already the BBC who.

Develop dynamic semantic publishing solution based on on thesetechnologyschema.org with the main engine providers on the on the web would be would be a second, a second classical application scenario.
So with these application scenarios in mind we see a growing demand in transfer transferring the knowledge that is already there to do a larger audience.
What we're going to do is.
We are going to develop so-called living learning materials.
So at the end we will have an ebook that will be developed on iTunes U.
This is the channel that the Open University.

For its courses, we will deploy this also on other channels and we will release each chapter once it is already available and then actively promoted and monitor mailing lists and discussion forums where data practitioners and technology providers in the area are active in order to ensure that these materials really are up to date with respect to the needs and problems that these these people have.
What will happen next is that we will have a first draft of the overall ebook very, very soon, so this will be released before the summer break.

We will have the first chapters, which will be probably content that some of you already know about the fundamentals of Link data already in the in the second half of this year followed then by parts that are currently not covered by any training curriculum available.
How to use the data.
How to use specific tools, how to use statistical tools in order to analyze.
Data available as RDF and so on, and so forth and you will see us on all mailing lists and discussion forums that you probably know from the link data community.
From open data, answering questions, and taking up these questions in order to incorporate answers and solutions in our curriculum.
This is the fact sheet.
We started in May and we will go on for two years.
I've already introduced the partners were coordinated by CI Research in an Austria anwer.
Looking forward to welcome you on our training events that we will organize starting in the second half of this year.
Thank you very much.
